p.s: In the excerpt from the book Starr's state of mind is presented by means of point of view and narrative techniques.

In the first part of the excerpt the point of view switches between first personfirst-person point of view of the protagonist and I see him lying in the street (l. 6) and a third personthird-person narrator with limited point of view a large crowd is gathered in the street (l. 2).
By switching the point of view the reader gets the feeling that Starr is not sure if she wants to be there and if she really wants to speak up for Khalil.

This gets even more clear when the point of view in the second part keeps being the first personfirst-person point of view of the protagonist because it lets Starr appear appear more confident and focused on herself instead of all the other things that happen around her.
It also helps the reader to see what Starr is talking aobut and that she is now confident enough to speak up for Khalil.

Narrative techniques can also be found to present Starr's state of mind such as a flashback I stare too hard, the crowd disappear, and I see him lying in the street (ll. 5f) to show the reader that Starr still has fear and that she still suffers from this tragic event- It also provides the reader the information that she is meaglu and strong enough to speak up about Khalil because she cannot manage to live with the reality.
By not having more flashbacks in the the second part of the excerpt, it gets very clear that Starr is now confident and ready to speak about Khalil.

By foreshadowing The bullhorn is as heavy as a gun.Ironic ine Ms. Ofrah said to use my weapon (l. 3) the reader knows that Starr is ready to give the speec hand that what she is going to say is going to be as strong as a weapon and that she beliefsbelieves that she has the power and the confidence to give such a speech.

The aie of scenic mode as the mode of presentation A red, green and yellow school bus (ll. 1-3) underlines the importance of the situation and creates the feeling that Starr is rather nervous and has a lot of fear.

To sum up one can say that Starr Carter's state of mind evolves throughout the excerpt from a rather stressed and unsure state of mind if she is going to speak about Khalil, to a unlidert and clear decision that she is going to hold the speech.
